koohiiStory1: Mister T substitutes an arrow for a toothpick -- The keyword meaning is to replace something with something else, to act for another, to represent. It´s best to stick to the first meaning, because the last two are very close to "mediator" which will come in frame 1761. The idea here is that the arrow is not a toothpick, neither it is changed into one, but it can substitute for one.
koohiiStory2: Mr. T shot the substitute teacher with an arrow.
kunYomi: か.わる、かわ.る、かわ.り、-がわ.り、か.える、よ、しろ
readingExamples: 代理 (だいり), 世代 (せだい), 現代 (げんだい), 代える (か.える), 代わる (か.わる), 代 (しろ), 代 (よ)
words: to exchange, to interchange, to substitute, to replace
to take the place of, to relieve, to be substituted for, to be exchanged, to change places with, to take turns, to be replaced
family predecessor, previous age, previous generation
pay by proxy, act for another, speak for another
take the place of, relieve, be substituted for, be exchanged, change places with, take turns, be replaced
price, payment, cost, charge, the money, the bill
representative, representation, delegation, type, example, model
representation, agency, proxy, deputy, agent, attorney, substitute, alternate, acting (principal, etc.)
